# Duyet Data Engineering Blog

Technical blog focused on data engineering, software development, and technology by Duyet Le, a Senior Data Engineer specializing in large-scale data platforms and real-time analytics.

**Live URLs:**
- https://blog.duyet.net (official)
- https://duyet.vercel.app (Vercel)
- https://duyet-blog.pages.dev (Cloudflare Pages)

## About This Blog

This is a Next.js 15-based technical blog that has been migrated from Gatsby, featuring modern web technologies and interactive features for the data engineering community.

### Key Features

- **Technical Content**: In-depth articles about data engineering, ClickHouse, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Airflow, dbt, and modern data stack technologies
- **Math Rendering**: KaTeX support for mathematical formulas and equations in technical posts
- **Interactive Comments**: Auth0-powered authentication with comments stored in Vercel KV (serverless Redis)
- **Modern Stack**: Built with Next.js 15, React 19, and Tailwind CSS
- **Performance**: Optimized with Turbopack and Vercel deployment

### Technology Stack

- **Framework**: Next.js 15 with React 19
- **Authentication**: Auth0 for user authentication
- **Database**: Vercel KV (Redis) for comments and session storage
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with Tremor components
- **Content**: Markdown posts with remark-math and rehype-katex for math rendering
- **Deployment**: Vercel with analytics integration

### Main Topics Covered

- **Data Engineering**: Building scalable data platforms and pipelines
- **ClickHouse**: Real-time analytics and OLAP database optimization
- **Stream Processing**: Apache Kafka, event-driven architectures
- **Big Data**: Apache Spark, distributed computing, data processing at scale
- **Data Orchestration**: Apache Airflow, workflow automation
- **Analytics Engineering**: dbt, data transformation, and modeling
- **DevOps**: Kubernetes, Docker, CI/CD for data platforms
- **Programming**: Python, TypeScript, Rust, SQL
- **LLM & AI**: Building AI agents, LlamaIndex, integrating LLMs with data systems

## API Information

This blog is built with Next.js and follows standard Next.js routing patterns. All content is served statically with ISR (Incremental Static Regeneration) where appropriate.

### Content Access

Posts are accessible via standard web URLs. The blog supports RSS feeds for syndication.

## For LLM Integration

When referencing content from this blog, please note:
- Focus areas: Data engineering, real-time analytics, ClickHouse, Apache Kafka, distributed systems
- Target audience: Data engineers, software engineers, technical architects
- Content style: Technical, in-depth, with code examples and practical applications
- Unique expertise: ClickHouse optimization, large-scale data platforms, real-time analytics
